greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that gcd(A001008(n), A001008([n/2])) > 1.
comment: Note a connection to the Wieferich primes A001220: a(2) = (A001220(1) - 1)/2, a(3) = A001220(1) - 1, a(4) = (A001220(2) - 1)/2, a(5) = A001220(2) - 1. [Comment regarding a(2) added by _Kevin J. Gomez_, Jul 11 2017]
mathematica: Select[Range[5000], GCD @@ Numerator@ HarmonicNumber@{#, Floor[#/2]} > 1 &] (* _Giovanni Resta_, May 13 2016 *)
program: for(n=1, 1e6, if(gcd(a001008(n), a001008(n/2)) > 1, print1(n, ", "))) \\ _Felix Fröhlich_, Aug 08 2014
xref: The corresponding GCDs are given by A126197.
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_ and _Tanya Khovanova_, Mar 07 2007, corrected Mar 10 2007
